alert.note: Alert for Northwest Blue Mountains (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 11:28AM PDT until May 19 at 6:12PM PDT by NWS Pendleton
info.description: .A significant amount of moisture combined with slow moving thunderstorms may result in localized heavy rain with flash flooding in portions of Central and Eastern Oregon, and along the Washington Cascades this afternoon and evening. Primary concerns reside near recent burn scars from wildfires over the past two to three years. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. Rainfall rates of up to an inch an hour will be possible with areas of stronger thunderstorms. * WHERE...Portions of Oregon and Washington, including the following areas, in Oregon, East Slopes of the Oregon Cascades, Grande Ronde Valley, Northern Blue Mountains of Oregon, Ochoco-John Day Highlands, Southern Blue Mountains of Oregon and Wallowa County. In Washington, Northwest Blue Mountains and Upper Slopes of the Eastern Washington Cascades Crest. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
